lead_paragraph: When we sell or pass down beloved possessions, out of necessity or just desire, we often hope that the new owners will treasure them as much as we did. We want the buyer of that used car we had in college, the one we can't afford the insurance for, to take as good care of it as we did. Maybe better. We want the friend who gets our old party dresses to party in them, too.
snippet: Should sellers of homes add personal opinion about the buyer to their list of considerations?

headline.main: When Money Alone Doesn't Qualify a Buyer

abstract: Should sellers of homes add personal opinion about the buyer to their list of considerations?
